title.narrative: Multinational - Central Africa Biodiversity Conservation Programme – Protecting Central Africa’s Elephants
Multinational - Programme de conservation de la biodiversité en Afrique centrale - Sauvegarde des éléphants d’Afrique centrale

description.narrative: Le Programme de conservation de la biodiversité en Afrique centrale (PCBAC) est une opération d'investissement pour la conservation de la biodiversité à travers la protection des éléphants de savane (Loxodonta Africana) dans la partie nord de l'Afrique centrale. Au cours de ces dernières années, une intense activité de braconnage des éléphants a, en effet, été constatée en Afrique centrale. Ce programme devrait permettre d’apporter des réponses à cette grave menace qui met en péril la survie des éléphants de savane et qui pourrait conduire, à terme, à leur disparition dans la région de l'Afrique centrale comme ce fut le cas avec deux espèces de rhinocéros (le Ceratotherium simum cottoni & le Diceros bicornis) dans la sous-région. Pour atteindre son objectif, le programme s'articule autour de deux composantes : (i) la gestion transfrontalière améliorée avec des volets de lutte anti-braconnage et de sensibilisation ; et (ii) la gestion du programme. La durée du programme est de 3 ans et son coût total est estimé à UA 3,98 millions d’UC, dont un don / prêt de 3,00 millions d'UC, une contribution de 0,78 million d'UC de la Communauté économique des États de l'Afrique centrale (CEEAC) et 0,2 million d’UC de la part des États bénéficiaires.

The Biodiversity Conservation Programme in Central Africa (PCBAC) is an investment operation for biodiversity conservation through savannah elephants (Loxodonta Africana) protection in the Northern part of Central Africa. In recent years, there has been intense elephant poaching activity in Central Africa. The programme should help to confront this severe threat to the survival of savannah elephants, which could ultimately lead to their disappearance from the Central Africa region as was the case earlier with two of the subregion’s rhino species (Ceratotherium simum cottoni & Diceros bicornis). To achieve its objective, the programme comprises two components: (i) improved border management, which has anti-poaching and sensitization aspects; and (ii) programme management. The programme period is 3 years. Its total cost estimate is UA 3.98 million, of which an ADF grant/loan of UA 3.00 million, an Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) contribution of UA 0.78 million and UA 0.2 million from beneficiary States.

Les principaux bénéficiaires du programme seront : (i) les services de conservation de la faune du complexe transfrontalier du Cameroun et du Tchad dont les capacités d'intervention sur le terrain seront renforcées et les membres du personnel formés ; (ii) les acteurs nationaux et toutes les parties prenantes de la conservation au niveau local qui seront sensibilisés en vue de leur implication à la lutte anti-braconnage transfrontalière dans la zone du programme (populations, leaders d’opinion et chefs traditionnels, élus locaux et nationaux, réseau de radios communautaires, société civile, etc.) ; (iii) les services de conservation de la faune au niveau central en République centrafricaine et d’autres services en charge de la lutte contre la criminalité faunique ; et (iv) les Gouvernements et la CEEAC dont les structures seront renforcées.

The key programme beneficiaries will be: (i) the wildlife conservation services of the Cameroon - Chad trans-border complex, whose response capabilities in the field will be strengthened, and trained personnel; (ii) national actors and all conservation stakeholders at the local level who will be sensitized in view of their involvement in fighting trans-border poaching in the programme area (population, opinion and traditional leaders, local and national elected officials, community radio network, civil society, etc.); (iii) central level wildlife conservation services in Central African Republic and other services in charge of fighting wildlife crime; and (iv) Governments and ECCAS whose structures will be strengthened.

L’objectif du programme est de stabiliser la taille de la population des éléphants de savane au Cameroun et au Tchad, et d’appuyer les institutions en charge de la protection de la faune et de la flore en République centrafricaine.

The programme’s objective is to stabilize the size of the savannah elephant population in Cameroon and Chad, and support institutions tasked with protecting fauna and flora in Central African Republic.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: Partnership with community radios for the dissemination of produced programmes
Increased number of Mixed Patrols comprising anti-poaching (surveillance) rangers
Training on biodiversity conservation awareness campaign techniques in rural communities
Popularisation and dissemination of communication tools on PCBAC-SEAC during major events
Increased number of media and advocacy actions on illegal ivory trade
Training on anti-poaching methods, intelligence, surveillance and prosecution
Intervention strategy and control actions in cross-border areas
Sensitisation/reflection on the critical situation of elephant corridors in Cameroon’s Far North (Waza-Kalamaloué corridor and WAZA -Agro-Pastoral Triangle (Kalfou-Bogo-Mindif-Kaélé) corridor)
Increased number of Ministerial Orders and Unit Reports
Procurement of Conquest and Inreach Delorme units
Increased number and type of harmonised anti-poaching legislation
Training on Wildlife Management Law Enforcement issues
Increased number oftargeted awareness campaigns conducted
Training on the problem of poaching, illegalivory trade and their related effects
Public discussions on wildlife crime involving strategic actors on radio and television in the three countries
Trainingon wildlife crime and wildlife law enforcement
Training on the problem of organised poaching, and wildlife crime
Decision-making onthe creation of a National Coordinating Unit (CCN) to combat wildlife crime in CAR, Cameroon and Chad

actual.value: The reference document for the establishment and operationalization of the National Coordinating Unit for Wildlife Crime Control in CAR (CCN-LCF RCA) prepared and the draft Decision establishing the CCN-LCF prepared and transmitted to the Council of Ministers.In Chad, a committee was established for this purpose, with an instrument that was issued in March 2017.InCameroon,there is the AP Committee, equivalent to the CCN, but it needed updating. The revamped instrument was validated in the workshop and submitted to hierarchy for adoption
